text: Our planned highlight, to the end of our Sri Lankan tour, was a frustrating disappointment.  We arrived tired and sick, hoping for a clean comfortable room and some simple food.  Even though we had booked and paid 6 months earlier, it took a long time to allocate us a room.  The room smelled of mould and mould was easily found in the bathroom. My wife complained, but all the staff could do was find the missing outdoor furniture. At dinner, the first night, we had difficulty finding plain food, that would not aggravate our upset stomachs.  The chef kindly offered to prepare mashed potatoes, peas and grilled chicken, for us, the next night. However, the next day, this offer was undone by management, who declared we had been selected for "Fine dining". Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for.  At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar.  After my wife presented mouldy toiletries to management, they did offer to change rooms, on the second day; but it was too little too late.  The hotel has an impressive entrance and sea view.  But what good are those when the hotel fails the basics of room and food.

text: The hotel needs refurbishment.  Some of the corridors and courtyards were in a very poor state. The meals were OK, although not up to 5 star standard. There was only one ala carte restaurant. The Gym was very poorly equipped and certainly did not merit a 5 star status.

We felt we could not relax whilst in the grounds, the local sellers both men and women, hid in the bushes of the hotel on the beach, waiting to get people's attention.  As soon as you stepped onto the beach, you were surrounded by them.  Also so much rubbish strewn about the perimeter.  Overall the hotel lacked any atmosphere, maybe it is too large for that?
The staff were all lovely and friendly.  For the money we both felt very let down, it is marked as a 5 star hotel but I would disagree with that.

text:
Stay was great but
1.  Considering there is nothing nearby to eat the food choices for A la cart and Room service are very very limited.
2. Phone receiver was smelly. None of the buttons worked
3. Door stopper broken and the the door kept banging if left open for a few seconds
4. Space beneath bed had not been swept or cleaned in a long time
5. TV was not working .
Hotel staff were warm and Service was lovely. The location and rooms were fabulous, so we overlooked all faults except  Point number 1 on Food.

text: Our planned highlight, to the end of our Sri Lankan tour, was a frustrating disappointment.  We arrived tired and sick, hoping for a clean comfortable room and some simple food.  Even though we had booked and paid 6 months earlier, it took a long time to allocate us a room.  The room smelled of mould and mould was easily found in the bathroom. My wife complained, but all the staff could do was find the missing outdoor furniture. At dinner, the first night, we had difficulty finding plain food, that would not aggravate our upset stomachs.  The chef kindly offered to prepare mashed potatoes, peas and grilled chicken, for us, the next night. However, the next day, this offer was undone by management, who declared we had been selected for "Fine dining". Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for.  At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar.  After my wife presented mouldy toiletries to management, they did offer to change rooms, on the second day; but it was too little too late.  The hotel has an impressive entrance and sea view.  But what good are those when the hotel fails the basics of room and food.

text:
We felt we could not relax whilst in the grounds, the local sellers both men and women, hid in the bushes of the hotel on the beach, waiting to get people's attention.  As soon as you stepped onto the beach, you were surrounded by them.  Also so much rubbish strewn about the perimeter.  Overall the hotel lacked any atmosphere, maybe it is too large for that?

text: Our planned highlight, to the end of our Sri Lankan tour, was a frustrating disappointment.  We arrived tired and sick, hoping for a clean comfortable room and some simple food.  Even though we had booked and paid 6 months earlier, it took a long time to allocate us a room.  The room smelled of mould and mould was easily found in the bathroom. My wife complained, but all the staff could do was find the missing outdoor furniture. At dinner, the first night, we had difficulty finding plain food, that would not aggravate our upset stomachs.  The chef kindly offered to prepare mashed potatoes, peas and grilled chicken, for us, the next night. However, the next day, this offer was undone by management, who declared we had been selected for "Fine dining". Fearing this was Sringlish for extra spicy, we gave up and went to bed early, without dinned, which we had already paid for.  At least at checkout, as some compensation, the hotel did not charge for the sandwich and hamburger, we had at the bar.  After my wife presented mouldy toiletries to management, they did offer to change rooms, on the second day; but it was too little too late.  The hotel has an impressive entrance and sea view.  But what good are those when the hotel fails the basics of room and food.
